title: UFC on ESPN 6 results: Joe Lauzon steamrolls Jonathan Pearce for hometown win
text:
Joe Lauzon was open during UFC on ESPN 6 fight week about the fact that his hometown matchup against Jonathan Pearce might be his final fight.

But with the way he rolled over his younger foe underneath all the Bruins and Celtics championship banners at Boston’s TD Garden on Friday night, the E. Bridgewater, Mass. native wasn’t about to make any decisions to ride off into the sunset just yet.

Lauzon (28-15 MMA, 15-12 UFC) put on a clinic in the lightweight main-card bout, as he schooled the upstart before finishing him via TKO at 1:33 of the opening round.

“This is my house,” Lauzon told his adoring throng of fans. “This is my cage. I was not letting everyone come in here and push me around.”

It was clear from the get-go Lauzon’s striking was sharp. His jabs immediately found a home. He upped the tempo and eventually wobbled Pearce.

Lauzon clinched Pearce (9-4 MMA, 0-1 UFC), went for a trip, and got it after several attempts. From there, mounted on Pearce’s back, he got his opponent into a half-nelson, where he rained down punches on his defenseless foe until referee Herb Dean waved things off.

“Maybe it’s the last one, maybe it’s not,” Lauzon said. “I’m going to go home, be happy, and just kind of play with my kids.”

Lauzon snapped a three-fight losing streak with his 26th career finish. Pearce, who was making his UFC debut, had a five-fight win streak snapped.
